Name: IRTG 2804 Tübingen-Uppsala Neuroimaging and Genetic Data
Acknowledgements: This project was funded by the German Research Foundation (DFG) and supported by Eberhard Karls University of Tübingen and Uppsala University.
Description: This dataset comprises neuroimaging, (epi-)genetic, hormonal, and psychometric data collected as part of the IRTG 2804 Tübingen-Uppsala research initiative. The primary objective is to investigate the interaction between genetic, hormonal, and neural factors in mental health across different reproductive phases in women.
EthicsApprovals: All projects were approved by the Ethics committee of the Medical Faculty of the University of Tübingen.

AnalysisPipelines.HormonalAndInflammationMarkers: Standardized analytical procedures performed in a central lab.

ReproducibilityAndStandardization.CollaborationsAndInfrastructure: Close collaboration with the Quantitative Biology Center (QBiC) and the Zentrum für Datenverarbeitung (ZDV). Utilization of the de.NBI Cloud for high-performance and cloud computing.
